content: Since #91598 and related issues are about a big regression in compile time (and memory) would that be a worthy addition to perf.rlo? Or do we have other places in the test suite that could catch those?
rustc-perf certainly has a number of benchmarks in it for cases that used to cause pathological behaviour. E.g. the ones with issue in their name.

On a related note, in rustc-perf I would like to better distinguish the "real world" benchmarks from the artificial ones: microbenchmarks and stress tests. Often the latter are the noisiest because they tend to be small; they're also less interesting in general.
